item.title: Alliances
item.description: #library - The birds. They are forming alliances.
#books - Woo. That new Brandon Sanderson is a beast of a book. Over 1300 pages.

#ope - We miss living in the city. We miss living in the burbs. We miss being surrounded by infrastructure and people and man-made stuff. We miss ring roads and interstates and mass transit. We miss diversity in people and culture and action.
#pnw - Coastal Hazard Message. National Weather Service.

item.title: Plaid Pantry
item.description: #writing - Added a new story, Plaid Pantry, to The Little Oregon Book of Horrors.

item.title: Rejection
item.description: #books - DNF'd Rejection by Tony Tulathimutte. Very well written book. Only made it through the second story, Pics, though. After reading it I was in a funk, didn't even realize it until Stacy asked me if I was okay. After that I decided to drop the book. But such good writing!

item.title: Ocean Dip
item.description: #pnw - This guy walks down the bluffs to the ocean for a dip every day. Winter. summer. Rain. Shine. In only a swimsuit.

item.title: Harleys Angels: The Strange and Terrible Saga of the Middle-Aged Motorcyclist
item.description: #writing - He wobbled to a stop, barely able to hold up the 850 pound chrome monster while getting the kickstand down. "Brothers!" he yelled, fist bumping the waiting trio. "Brother!" they harrumphed ...and having validated their Harleyness they mounted their rolling metal and made noise...booming stentorian noise ...and pulled out past children holding their hands to their ears and parents clucking their tongues in disapproval â€“ for this is what they lived for, making the world know they were the biggest and loudest bad asses on the planet and their passage would be marked through sound of exhaust, shine of chrome, and drip of oil.

item.title: Fosse Fosse
item.description: #wwww - Walk it out Fosse. Mexican Breakfast Fosse.
